Quickstrike:






Quickstrike tossed his head and moaned as he heard clicking outside of the 
Predacon cave. But he paid it no mind, just found it annoying, disturbing 
his rest. He stretched out, arching his back, and rested again. He had no 
trouble getting back to sleep.

He dreamt of Blackarachnia. He dreamt of them in the Darkside. He could 
almost smell the lava that sometimes lingered in the base, and he could 
almost smell Blackarachnia. He could hear her voice, but he couldn't make 
out much of what she said.

He went to touch her, but she backed away, grinning; just like her games. He 
tried again, and this time she moved to his side and kicked his leg 
playfully. Quickstrike thought of it fun now. He knew it was a dream, but he 
wish it was real. He wanted to be with Blackarachnia again.

"Told ya you'd make it," he heard her say.
"What?" he returned, a little confused why she said that. He was expecting 
something different from her. He stepped closer, and this time she stayed 
still. He watched her figure. He couldn't make out everything. He moved in 
until they touched shoulders.

His moment of contempt didn't last long, something dark busted through the 
wall of the hallway, and slammed him against the other side. He saw it, 
covered in the darkness, the Vok wolf. He opened its jaws to bite down on 
him.

"NO!" Quickstrike jerked up out of his sleep, kicking at the air.
